item.title: Axl Rose performs first show with AC/DC
item.description: Despite having a fracture, Axl Rose still got off on a good foot for his first show with AC/DC.
item.ExtractedText:
Facebook Twitter Instagram
Axl Rose performs first show with AC/DC Updated 1543 GMT (2343 HKT) May 9, 2016 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC AC/DC has been one of the hardest-rocking -- and longest-lasting -- bands on the scene. The group formed in 1973 in Sydney, Australia. Here's a look back at the rockers through the years: Hide Caption 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC The band hangs out with their manager Michael Browning, right, in 1976. Hide Caption 2 of 14 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC Angus Young sits on Bon Scott's shoulders while performing at the Town Hall in St. Albans, England, in 1976. Young is known for performing in a schoolboy uniform. Hide Caption 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC AC/DC performs at the Kursaal Ballroom in England in 1977. Hide Caption 4 of 14 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC Left to right: Phillip Rudd, Angus Young, Mark Evans, Malcolm Young and Bon Scott pose for a photo in 1977. Scott, who was the lead singer of the band in the '70s, died in 1980. Hide Caption 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC Angus Young performs in Chicago in 1979. Hide Caption 6 of 14 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC Devoted fans wait in the cold and snow to buy tickets for AC/DC's Denver show in 1982. Hide Caption 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC The band poses for a photo at a bar in Rhode Island in 1985. Hide Caption 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC AC/DC performs at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, New York, in 1986. Hide Caption 9 of 14 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC Brian Johnson and Angus Young perform in Leiden, Netherlands, in 1991. Johnson took over as lead singer and sang on AC/DC's biggest hits, including "Back in Black" and "You Shook Me All Night Long." Hide Caption 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC The "Hells Bells" bell is seen on stage at an AC/DC concert in 2000. Hide Caption 11 of 14 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC Steven Tyler of Aerosmith, center, poses with AC/DC at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony in 2003. Hide Caption 12 of 14 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC The band shoots the video for their song "Rock 'n' Roll Train" in London in 2008. The group's 2008 album "Black Ice" was the second-biggest album of the year, with 6 million sold. Hide Caption 14 photos: Aussie rock legends AC/DC Angus Young performs with the band onstage in Melbourne in 2010. Hide Caption
